content:
How is this possible?
https://epoch.ai/benchmarks/terminal-bench

On other benchmarks too
# Terminal-Bench 2.0
A benchmark of tasks which require a model to complete tasks using a computer terminal, testing its ability to understand and employ the programs available to it.
author: boas_#0

content: thinking does not always mean better.
author: fidesratioque#0

content: the model's trained to 'think first' = better output, but that only applies for the use cases where they trained it that way. if it didn't get trained to think in other areas you might get worse output regardless. e.g.: model got a lot of training about thinking about writing tasks, so think mode works well for that. but if it didn't get training for coding tasks, it'll not know how to use think mode to good effect. the training is basically: you run tasks for x-number of times, and each time it thinks first + gets better output, you reward the model, so if it didn't get that done to it, you won't see the benefit from think mode.
author: fidesratioque#0

content: (sorry if I'm missing the point of your question btw)
author: fidesratioque#0

content: True but you would expect thinking to help on math/coding tests, and this is one of those coding tests

content:
> Sakana AI‚Äôs ‚ÄúALE-Agent‚Äù achieved a historic milestone by securing 1st place in the AtCoder Heuristic Contest 058, outperforming 804 human participants. To contextualize the difficulty of these optimization challenges, an OpenAI agent previously secured 2nd place in the AHC world tournament last August. This victory marks the first known instance of an AI agent winning a major optimization programming contest in real-time.
<https://sakana.ai/ahc058/>
author: sunsweeper#0

content:
> ALE-Agent is an agent that performs algorithm discovery by utilizing multiple LLMs to create solutions in parallel, selecting the best ones, and reasoning further based on the results of trial and error.
They used GPT-5.2 (high) and Gemini 3 Pro. In the logs, it seems like GPT-5.2's solution were used 6/8 times, with the final winning submission generated by GPT-5.2.

Logs here: <https://sakanaai.github.io/fishylene-ahc058/>

author: nothitler69#0

content: I can guarantee it didn't read the whole file, as the total context is only 200k tokens; it will, however, explore your project to find things to try to understand your requests. You can help that a lot by giving it good documentation with indexed references to where to find various things, so it doesn't have to do as much exploration

author: lucidream1028#0

content:
An IDE (Integrated Development Environment) is an application you use to write code. It comes with features to make the code-writing process easier.

A CLI (Command Line Interface) is basically just a terminal window where you work with it using text.
